documentation.text: @param racAddress address for the raising access controller.

@notice allows owner to disable the warning flags for multiple addresses.
@param subjects List of the contract addresses whose flag is being lowered

@notice allows owner to change the access controller for raising flags.
@param racAddress new address for the raising access controller.

attributes.text: @param racAddress address for the raising access controller.

@notice allows owner to disable the warning flags for multiple addresses.
@param subjects List of the contract addresses whose flag is being lowered

@notice allows owner to change the access controller for raising flags.
@param racAddress new address for the raising access controller.

acceptOwnership().details: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

params.racAddress: address for the raising access controller.

params.subject: The contract address being checked for a flag.

returns._0: A true value indicates that a flag was raised and a false value indicates that no flag was raised.

params.subjects: An array of addresses being checked for a flag.

returns._0: An array of bools where a true value for any flag indicates that a flag was raised and a false value indicates that no flag was raised.

params.subjects: List of the contract addresses whose flag is being lowered

params.subject: The contract address whose flag is being raised

params.subjects: List of the contract addresses whose flag is being raised

params.racAddress: new address for the raising access controller.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

addAccess(address).notice: Adds an address to the access list

getFlag(address).notice: read the warning flag status of a contract address.

getFlags(address[]).notice: read the warning flag status of a contract address.

hasAccess(address,bytes).notice: Returns the access of an address

lowerFlags(address[]).notice: allows owner to disable the warning flags for multiple addresses.

raiseFlag(address).notice: enable the warning flag for an address. Access is controlled by raisingAccessController, except for owner who always has access.

raiseFlags(address[]).notice: enable the warning flags for multiple addresses. Access is controlled by raisingAccessController, except for owner who always has access.

removeAccess(address).notice: Removes an address from the access list

setRaisingAccessController(address).notice: allows owner to change the access controller for raising flags.

userdoc.notice: Allows flags to signal to any reader on the access control list. The owner can set flags, or designate other addresses to set flags. The owner must turn the flags off, other setters cannot. An expected pattern is to allow addresses to raise flags on themselves, so if you are subscribing to FlagOn events you should filter for addresses you care about.
